Articles.Content: The stock longer wings, stacked on eachother.
Are they fairly sturdy in that arrangement? I had trouble with bending wings with only a single pair at high loads...

> 
> Are they fairly sturdy in that arrangement? I had trouble with bending wings with only a single pair at high loads...

They\'re *fairly* sturdy, but he\'s probably got a bunch of struts on the underside to keep it that straight.
Guess who?

> Guess who?

cessna
I don\'t think this is a real flying aircraft, this configuration does not seem stable to me...

> 
> Guess who?

It looks very Rutan-ish. I\'d say it\'s meant to be Long-EZ or a VariEze, but it doesn\'t have canards.
Hint: I usually fly it without canards, even though they are included on the IRL glider.

> 
> Guess who?

MiG-8 'Duck'

![Mikoyan-GurevichMiG-8.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/f/f7/Mikoyan-GurevichMiG-8.jpg)
I thought so, but the lack of canards threw me off. Nicely done, though! 8)

> 
> MiG-8 'Duck'

Nope, I can see why though ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

oops. Here, wait a second whilst I kick myself for being an idiot XD
Name the attached plane! 8) Fist one to correctly guess get to fly it!
Rutan Quickie?

DINGDINGDING!!!

Heads up: I still haven\'t adjusted the center of lift properly, leading to a slight nose-up tendancy. Also, requires Damned Aeronautics, C7 pack, **Fixed Camera**, and Down Under pack.

EDIT: added forgotten part pack, and tips.

Tip: lock the ASAS BEFORE engine start, and you\'ll float right off the runway. Fly using the lower power controls, especially during rolls, as she can snap roll very fast. Also, do NOT apply brakes on landing: You\'ll tumble and trash the aircraft. Finally, the landing speed seems a little hot, so do mind that on approach.
